document.text:
From 
To 
Subject: RE: Epstein 
Date: Sun, 23 Mar 2008 01:41:04 +0000 
Importance: Normal 
I recommended calling the police as well. I will pass this on to The DOJ Victim-Witness coordinator is going to call 
all the victims on Monday to offer the services of the pro bono lawyers and I will recommend that she add something about 
calling the police in case of any further harassment. Thanks. 
 Original
From: 
Se • 
To:
Cc: 
Su . . 
Hi 
Can wive the parents a contact the local PD so they can call the police at a moments notice and file a police 
report? I'm hoping the DC mtgs end soon so we can proceed. My fear is that drawing nto this will side track that 
goal. 
Sent from my BlackBerry Wireless Handheld 
From: 
To: 
Cc: 
Sent: Sat Mar 22 20:51:02 2008 
Subject: Epstein 
Hi all —  So sorry to bother you on a Saturday, but I am hoping that I can persuade you to reach out toMabout Epstein's 
investigators harassing the girls. received a frantic call today about Epstein's investigators bothering the parents of 
one of the victims. According to the victim, he demanded to see the victim and when he saw her, he told the victim that 
they had video of till", were planning to put it on the intemet. We don't believe that Epstein actually has video of 
any of the girls, and as calmed the girl down, but this activity seems to be getting more aggressive. Remember 
also that Epstein is using the state criminal case to subpoena depositions of victims in the federal case (who are not part of 
the state indictment) to get information about our invention. These actions do not seem consistent with what Epstein's 
attorneys are supposed to be trying to work out with in DC. Any chance will ask Epstein's people to call off 
their dogs until he makes his decision? 
EFTA00013659
